MajorClaims.MC1: these various advertisements get people to buy products that are unnecessary and only look good on television
MajorClaims.MC2: The power of advertising maybe over-rated, we can not deny that the final decision is on the hands of us consumers

Claims.C1: it is not about the function or quality of the commodities themselves but really the promotion of the good feeling of possessing the product
Claims.C2: it plays and important role economically

Premises.P1: To boost their sales and win over customers, companies pour a great amount of money into advertising
Premises.P2: huge cooperation hire celebrities as the face of their product
Premises.P3: By casting famous singers in their television advertisement, motorcycles or clothes for example, sales increase significantly
Premises.P4: youngsters, as the target consumers, love celebrities
Premises.P5: having these products shows their status
Premises.P6: the quality obviously is not relatively important
Premises.P7: they aim to grab your attention
Premises.P8: They introduce new products, and provide various choices, not to mention they are often visually enjoyable
Premises.P9: advertisements can be falseful and exaggerated
Premises.P10: Advertising also helps to keep prices at reasonable levels, creates a fair environment for commercial competition
Premises.P11: Otherwise the market may be monopolistic, and the price as well as the choice will not be so selective
